text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-MedicationAdministration.dosage

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..1Extension(4.0.1)Details of how medication was taken
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:text 0..1ExtensionFree text dosage instructions e.g. SIG
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage.text"
value[x] 0..1stringFree text dosage instructions e.g. SIG
extension:site 0..1ExtensionBody site administered to
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage.site"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptBody site administered to
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-approach-site-codes-for-R4 (example): A coded concept describing the site location the medicine enters into or onto the body.
extension:route 0..1ExtensionPath of substance into body
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage.route"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptPath of substance into body
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-route-codes-for-R4 (example): A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.
extension:method 0..1ExtensionHow drug was administered
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage.method"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptHow drug was administered
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-administration-method-codes-for-R4 (example): A coded concept describing the technique by which the medicine is administered.
extension:dose 0..1ExtensionAmount of medication per dose
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage.dose"
value[x] 0..1SimpleQuantity(4.0.1)Amount of medication per dose
extension:rate 0..1ExtensionDose quantity per unit of time
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate"
value[x] 0..1Dose quantity per unit of time
valueRatioRatio
valueQuantityQuantity(SimpleQuantity)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-MedicationAdministration.dosage"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionMedicationAdministration_Dosage
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.MedicationAdministration.dosage` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `MedicationAdministration.dosage` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `MedicationAdministration.dosage` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`MedicationAdministration.dosage` 0..1 `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `MedicationAdministration.dosage` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `MedicationAdministration.dosage` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `MedicationAdministration.dosage` 0..1 `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `MedicationAdministration.dosage` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `MedicationAdministration.dosage`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Details of how medication was taken
element.definition: Describes the medication dosage information details e.g. dose, rate, site, route, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG
element.definition: Free text dosage can be used for cases where the dosage administered is too complex to code. When coded dosage is present, the free text dosage may still be present for display to humans.The dosage instructions should reflect the dosage of the medication that was administered.
element.requirements:
Element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.text` is part of an existing definition because parent element `MedicationAdministration.dosage` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.text` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.text`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.short: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG
element.definition: Free text dosage can be used for cases where the dosage administered is too complex to code. When coded dosage is present, the free text dosage may still be present for display to humans.The dosage instructions should reflect the dosage of the medication that was administered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first entered the body.  For example, "left arm".
element.comment: If the use case requires attributes from the BodySite resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/bodySite](http://hl7.org/fhir/extensions/StructureDefinition-bodySite.html).  May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.

element.definition: A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is intended to be or was introduced into or on the body.  This attribute will most often NOT be populated.  It is most commonly used for injections.  For example, Slow Push, Deep IV.
element.comment: One of the reasons this attribute is not used often, is that the method is often pre-coordinated with the route and/or form of administration.  This means the codes used in route or form may pre-coordinate the method in the route code or the form code.  The implementation decision about what coding system to use for route or form code will determine how frequently the method code will be populated e.g. if route or form code pre-coordinate method code, then this attribute will not be populated often; if there is no pre-coordination then method code may  be used frequently.
element.requirements:

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A coded concept describing the technique by which the medicine is administered.

element.definition: The amount of the medication given at one administration event.   Use this value when the administration is essentially an instantaneous event such as a swallowing a tablet or giving an injection.
element.comment: If the administration is not instantaneous (rate is present), this can be specified to convey the total amount administered over period of time of a single administration.
element.requirements:
Element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.dose` is part of an existing definition because parent element `MedicationAdministration.dosage` requires a cross-version extension.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: The amount of the medication given at one administration event.   Use this value when the administration is essentially an instantaneous event such as a swallowing a tablet or giving an injection.
element.comment: If the administration is not instantaneous (rate is present), this can be specified to convey the total amount administered over period of time of a single administration.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Dose quantity per unit of time
element.definition: Identifies the speed with which the medication was or will be introduced into the patient.  Typically, the rate for an infusion e.g. 100 ml per 1 hour or 100 ml/hr.  May also be expressed as a rate per unit of time, e.g. 500 ml per 2 hours.  Other examples:  200 mcg/min or 200 mcg/1 minute; 1 liter/8 hours.
element.comment: If the rate changes over time, and you want to capture this in MedicationAdministration, then each change should be captured as a distinct MedicationAdministration, with a specific MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate, and the date time when the rate change occurred. Typically, the MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate element is not used to convey an average rate.
element.requirements:
Element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `MedicationAdministration.dosage` requires a cross-version extension.
Note that the target element context `MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `MedicationAdministration.dosage`.
Element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate[x]`, but has no comparisons.
Note that the target element context `MedicationAdministration.dosage.rate[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `MedicationAdministration.dosage`.
